description: This file contains utility functions for implementing an AI opponent in a Tic-Tac-Toe game. It includes functions for cloning the game board, evaluating the winner, checking for draws, computing valid moves, and selecting the AI's move based on difficulty (random or optimal). The core of the AI's decision-making is implemented using the minimax algorithm.

methods.name: cloneBoard(board)
methods.description: Creates a defensive copy of the game board array.

methods.name: calculateWinner(board)
methods.description: Determines if there is a winner ('X' or 'O') on the board, else returns null.

methods.name: isDraw(board)
methods.description: Checks if the game is a draw (full board with no winner).

methods.name: emptyCells(board)
methods.description: Returns an array of indices for empty cells on the board.

methods.name: terminalScore(board, aiMark)
methods.description: Scores a terminal game state for minimax evaluation: +10 for AI win, -10 for opponent win, 0 for draw.

methods.name: minimax(board, aiMark, currentMark)
methods.description: Implements the minimax algorithm to evaluate the best move for the AI.

methods.name: getAIMove(board, aiMark, difficulty = 'random')
methods.description: Public function to select the AI's move based on difficulty ('random' or 'optimal'). Validates inputs, determines available moves, and uses either random selection or minimax to choose the move.
